member.name: T:Ice.Lib.Deployment.NonAutoDeployAssemblyRetriever
member.summary: Retrieves assemblies from non-Auto deployments.
member.remarks: If the core deployment type is Auto then have to make sure that files deployed from Zip or XCopy will not be overwritten by the core deployment or earlier custom deployments. This class loaded the manifest that was written for the non-Auto deployments when they were deployed from AutoUpdate. If one of the assemblies in this custom deployment is requested it is returned which keeps the earlier deployments from overwriting it.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.Deployment.NonAutoDeployAssemblyRetriever.#ctor(Ice.Lib.Deployment.AutoDeployRetrieverState,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Ensures the core manifest files are deployed.
member.remarks: This does nothing. All files are already downloaded for this type of retriever.

member.summary: Retrieves the assembly and all associated assemblies and files.
member.returns: The assembly if found, null otherwise.

member.name: T:Ice.Lib.Deployment.AutoDeployRetrieverState
member.summary: Maintains state for the Auto deployment retriever(s).
member.remarks: When an assembly is being retrieved, it might cause any number of other assemblies and associated files to be retrieved. This class maintains the state needed for this to be used across a number of assembly retrievers.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.Deployment.AutoDeployRetrieverState.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Ice.Lib.Deployment.AutoDeployRetrieverState.CompositeAutoRetriever
member.summary: Gets or sets the composite automatic retriever.

remarks.para: When an assembly is being retrieved it is possible that the assembly can have dependent assemblies in other deployments. For example a UI assembly could have an adapter as a dependent assembly. The adapter assembly may be in an "earlier" deployment. This composite Auto deployment retriever allows the individual retriever to use the composite retriever to retrieve the dependent assemblies and files. This allows the dependent assemblies and files to be in "earlier" or "later" deployments and still be deployed correctly.
This property must be set before assemblies with dependent assemblies and/or files are retrieved.

member.name: P:Ice.Lib.Deployment.AutoDeployRetrieverState.DeploymentPath
member.summary: Gets the deployment path.

member.value: The to be used by all retrievers.

member.summary: Ends the retrieve.
member.remarks: This must be called once for each .

member.name: T:Ice.Lib.Deployment.AutoDeployManifest
member.summary: Holds the collection of files, usually assemblies, that have already been downloaded to the client deployment directory.

remarks.para: The AutoDeployManifest.xml file can only be written to by one process at a time. It can be read by any number of users. The file is only read when necessary and is read as quickly as possibly. This is both for performance and so a writer can get an exclusive lock on it.
The manifest file name uses the customization name if one is given. For the name "CUST", the manifest file name will be AutoDeployManifest_CUST.xml.
To update the collection, you must call . After you make your changes you have to call . You can call if you don't want to save your changes.

member.param: Name of the customization. This may be null but can't be an empty or empty trimmed string.

member.name: T:Ice.Lib.Deployment.MinimalInstallFiles
member.summary: Manages files that are part of a minimal install.

remarks.para: There is a subset of files that are required to be able to run our application. These are the minimum files needed to be able to download the rest of the application. These files are always loaded whenever the application is running and therefore are always locked. There are two cases where these files are important to know.

The first case is when using the Auto deployment mechanism. Using this mechanism, files are downloaded as they are needed instead of all at once before the application runs. Since these minimal files cannot be overwritten, the Auto deployment mechanism must skip downloading them and just use the existing files.

The second case is when running AutoUpdate. These files cannot be deleted when clearing the client director, since that could leave the application un-runnable if the update fails. Also, they have to be updated as a group since the application would be un-runnable if some were updated and some were not.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.Deployment.MinimalInstallFiles.LoadAssembly(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads the existing assembly.
member.returns: The assembly if it is a minimal install assembly. Otherwise null.

member.summary: Gets the non-deployable assembly file names.
member.returns: The non-deployable assembly file names.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.Deployment.MinimalInstallFiles.GetNonAssemblyFileNames
member.summary: Gets the non-deployable non-assembly file names.
member.returns: The non-deployable non-assembly file names.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.Deployment.MinimalInstallFiles.IsMinimalInstallFile(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether is a non deployable file.
member.returns: true if the file is non deployable.

member.name: T:Ice.Lib.Utilities.ProgressIndicator
member.summary: A control that shows text for the action being done as well as an optional progress indicator.

remarks.para: This control has three different modes. The first is to show progress as a . Set to a positive value and to true for this mode. The second is to show progress as text. Set to -1 and to true for this mode. You can also set the to specify how the text is formatted. The third way is to not show progress at all. Only the action text is displayed. Set to false for this mode.
Use the property to determin if the control should grow to fit the text whenever it is changed. Use the property to determine how the control grows. Use and to set the current position, if any.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.Utilities.ProgressIndicator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show progress.
member.value: true if progress should be shown.
member.remarks: If this value is false then only the current action text is shown.

member.name: P:Ice.Lib.Utilities.ProgressIndicator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text associated with this control.
member.value: The text associated with this control.

member.name: P:Ice.Lib.Utilities.ProgressIndicator.TextProgressFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format to use when showing progress as text.
member.remarks: The value should be format used in a string.Format call. There should be one replacable parameter that will get replaced with the property converted to a string. The default is "{0}".

member.summary: Gets or sets the value.
member.remarks: The value must be less than the value.

The text to display in the title bar of the message box.

One of the System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxIcon values that specifies which icon to display in the message box.
One of the System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxDefaultButton values that specifies the default button for the message box.
One of the System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxOptions values that specifies which display and association options will be used for the message box. You may pass in 0 if you wish to use the defaults.
member.returns: One of the values.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.Utilities.StreamHelperBase.BuildUri(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Builds the from the specified parts.
member.returns: The from the specified parts.
member.remarks: If the is more than just the host name than the absolute part of the is would be lost if you use new Uri(uri, string). For example 'http://epicor/ServerDirectory' for a URL and 'myFileName.txt' for a path would produce 'http://epicor/myFileName.txt', losing the 'ServerDirectory' part. This method correctly builds the Uri of 'http://epicor/ServerDirectory/myFileName.txt'.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.Utilities.StreamHelperBase.BuildUri(System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Builds the from the specified parts.
member.returns: The from the specified parts.
member.remarks: If the is more than just the host name than the absolute part of the is would be lost if you use new Uri(uri, string). For example 'http://epicor/ServerDirectory' for a URL and 'myFileName.txt' for a path would produce 'http://epicor/myFileName.txt', losing the 'ServerDirectory' part. This method correctly builds the Uri of 'http://epicor/ServerDirectory/myFileName.txt'.

member.name: T:Ice.Lib.Utilities.WaitHandleHelper
member.summary: A helper utility for working with s.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.Utilities.WaitHandleHelper.DoAction(System.Threading.WaitHandle,System.Windows.Forms.MethodInvoker,Ice.Lib.Utilities.WaitDialog.QueryCancel,System.Windows.Forms.MethodInvoker)
member.summary: Does the action while locking on the specified .
member.param: A function that returns if the action has been canceled.
The action to release the wait handle.
member.returns: true if the action was run.
member.remarks: This method waits for the specified handle to be "set" or to have "ownership" of it. At that point the specified action is run. After the action is run, the is run to clean up the wait handle. This is necessary because different wait handles are released in different ways. See if there is an override of this method for that wait handle type. If the function returns true before we "own" the wait handle then this method returns without running the action and without running the action.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.Utilities.WaitHandleHelper.DoAction(System.Threading.EventWaitHandle,System.Windows.Forms.MethodInvoker,Ice.Lib.Utilities.WaitDialog.QueryCancel)
member.summary: Does the action while locking on the specified .
member.param: A function that returns if the action has been canceled.
member.returns: true if the action was run.
member.remarks: This method waits to have ownership of the specified . At that point the specified action is run. After the action is run, the is released. If the function returns true before we own the then this method returns without running the action.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.Utilities.WaitHandleHelper.DoAction(System.Threading.Mutex,System.Windows.Forms.MethodInvoker,Ice.Lib.Utilities.WaitDialog.QueryCancel)
member.summary: Does the action while locking on the specified .
member.param: A function that returns if the action has been canceled.
member.returns: true if the action was run.
member.remarks: This method waits to have ownership of the specified . At that point the specified action is run. After the action is run, the is released. If the function returns true before we own the then this method returns without running the action.

member.name: T:Ice.Lib.WellKnownAssemblyRetrievers
member.summary: Holds well known assembly retrievers.

member.name: P:Ice.Lib.WellKnownAssemblyRetrievers.AutoDeployAssemblyRetriever
member.summary: Gets or sets the that handles retrieving assemblies as they are needed.
member.value: The that handles retrieving assemblies as they are needed.
member.remarks: This properties value will be null if auto deployment isn't turned on. If auto deployment is turned on for a single deployment or customization then the value will be a . If it is turned on for multiple deployments then it will be a .

member.name: P:Ice.Lib.WellKnownAssemblyRetrievers.SessionlessAssemblyRetriever
member.summary: Gets or sets the to use to retrieve assemblies not associated with a specific session.
member.remarks: When there is no session or the retrieving is done without a session the should be used. If the Ice.UI.EpiClientLib.dll assembly has been loaded already then you should use the ClientAssemblyRetriever specifying a null session instead.
